intro: Delphinium hesperium var. seditiosum, commonly known as the western larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are showy, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is considered a perennial herb and is often found in meadows and open woodlands.
